ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would definitely recommend this class to students broadly interested in systems, security, protocols, and the way that decentralized systems work.

I would recommend it. After a very theoretical formation I was happy to get closer to actual code and practical algorithms. With this course you will learn technical skills and make sure you can be proficient at programming network applications.
Yes. You learn a lot about distributed systems.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I learned a great deal about a variety of topics and considerations involved in designing decentralized systems.

I feel like this decentralized systems course exposed me to clever and unknown (to me) algorithms. This is a very special kind of algorithms, they are really hard to grasp in a whole because they only make sense when interacting; and that is what makes them exciting. Being aware of them and able to implement them makes me feel like I really got something out of this course.I will probably complete my formation with a more theoretical course on decentralized systems since I feel like proof on these programs will involve clever and enlightening invariants.
